com.davidmiguel.gobees.utils

Class WeatherUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.davidmiguel.gobees.utils.WeatherUtils

  • public final class WeatherUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains useful utilities for a weather app. Such as conversion between Celsius and Fahrenheit, from kph to mph, and from degrees to NSEW. It also contains the mapping of weather condition codes in OpenWeatherMap to strings.

    • Method Detail

      • celsiusToFahrenheit

        static double celsiusToFahrenheit(double temperatureInCelsius)
        This method will convert a temperature from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
        Parameters:
        temperatureInCelsius - Temperature in degrees Celsius(°C).
        Returns:
        Temperature in degrees Fahrenheit (°F).

      • formatTemperature

        public static java.lang.String formatTemperature(android.content.Context context,
                                                 double temperature)
        Temperature data is stored in Celsius. Depending on the user's preference, the app may need to display the temperature in Fahrenheit. This method will perform that temperature conversion if necessary. It will also format the temperature so that no decimal points show. Temperatures will be formatted to the following form: "21°C".
        Parameters:
        context - Android Context to access preferences and resources.
        temperature - Temperature in degrees Celsius (°C).
        Returns:
        Formatted temperature String in the following form: "21°C"

      • formatHumidity

        public static java.lang.String formatHumidity(android.content.Context context,
                                              double humidity)
        Format humidity.
        Parameters:
        context - Android Context to access preferences and resources.
        humidity - Percentage of humidity, e.g: 18.
        Returns:
        Formatted humidity String in the following form: "18%"

      • formatPressure

        public static java.lang.String formatPressure(android.content.Context context,
                                              double pressure)
        Format pressure.
        Parameters:
        context - Android Context to access preferences and resources.
        pressure - Percentage of pressure, e.g: 1024.
        Returns:
        Formatted pressure String in the following form: "18 hPa"

      • formatWind

        public static java.lang.String formatWind(android.content.Context context,
                                          double windSpeed,
                                          double deg)
        This method uses the wind direction in degrees to determine compass direction as a String. (eg NW) The method will return the wind String in the following form: "2 km/h SW"
        Parameters:
        context - Android Context to access preferences and resources
        windSpeed - Wind speed in kilometers / hour
        deg - Degrees as measured on a compass, NOT temperature degrees! See https://www.mathsisfun.com/geometry/degrees.html
        Returns:
        Wind String in the following form: "2 km/h SW"

      • formatRainSnow

        public static java.lang.String formatRainSnow(android.content.Context context,
                                              double volume)
        Format rain/snow.
        Parameters:
        context - Android Context to access preferences and resources.
        volume - Rain volume (mm), e.g: 3.25.
        Returns:
        Formatted rain/snow String in the following form: "0.1 mm"

      • getWeatherIconResourceId

        public static int getWeatherIconResourceId(java.lang.String weatherIconId)
        Helper method to provide the icon resource id according to the weather condition id returned by the OpenWeatherMap call.
        Parameters:
        weatherIconId - from OpenWeatherMap API response. See http://openweathermap.org/weather-conditions for a list of all IDs.
        Returns:
        resource id for the corresponding icon. day_clear_sky if no relation is found.

      • getStringForWeatherCondition

        public static java.lang.String getStringForWeatherCondition(android.content.Context context,
                                                            int weatherId)
        Helper method to provide the string according to the weather condition id returned by the OpenWeatherMap call.
        Parameters:
        context - Android context.
        weatherId - from OpenWeatherMap API response. See http://openweathermap.org/weather-conditions for a list of all IDs
        Returns:
        String for the weather condition, condition_unknown if no relation is found.

      • convertDpToPixel

        public static float convertDpToPixel(android.content.res.Resources resources,
                                     float dp)
        Convert dp to pixels.
        Parameters:
        resources - android resources.
        dp - dps to convert.
        Returns:
        pixels.
